long: Meaning: to "cut" (off, down or asunder); by implication, to "destroy" or "consume"; specifically, to "covenant" (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces).  Usage: be chewed, be con-(feder-) ate, covenant, cut (down, off), destroy, fail, feller, be freed, hew (down), make a league (covenant), × lose, perish, × utterly, × want.  Source: a primitive root;
